title: Man pleads guilty to stabbing, killing siblings in Canton
title_page: Man pleads guilty to stabbing, killing siblings in Canton
text:
A Georgia man pleaded guilty last week to repeatedly stabbing the mother of his child and her brother in Canton in 2016, officials said.
José Tierrablanca-Gierro, 28 at the time of deadly double stabbing, was sentenced to two life sentences after entering a guilty plea to felony murder, Cherokee County District Attorney Shannon Wallace said.
According to prosecutors, Tierrablanca-Gierro stabbed Antonia Ruiz, 27, and Omar Ruiz, 23, in July 2016. Antonia Ruiz was the mother of his child, who was 18 months old at the time.
Officers responded to an assault call at the Laurels at Greenwood Apartments in the 1200 block of Hickory Flat Highway, police said.
RELATED: Siblings stabbed to death in Canton
On the third floor breezeway of building 3000, police found the victims. The man was dead. The woman was taken to Northside Hospital-Cherokee, where she was pronounced dead.
Tierrablanca-Gierro, who lived in Dallas in Paulding County, later surrendered to police.
﻿In other news:
